attributes.action: Make Religious and Moral Studies not mandatory in high schools.
attributes.additional_details:
In all state schools in Scotland, RME is compulsory. 
http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2005/03/20778/53820

It is time that is wasted and many private schools realise this as they do not have RME for every year of education. 
https://www.george-heriots.com/curriculum/senior
attributes.background: Religious and Moral Studies (also known as RME in some schools) is simply a subject designated to looking at different religions and moral issues. While in primary schools it can help children become aware of different religions and issues, it is a waste of 1 hour a week of high school pupil's time.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
